note.para: All maintenance procedures must be performed with the vehicle supported at the frame with safety stands, the front wheels blocked, and the suspension hanging unsupported.

svcsubsecinfo.para: The rubber suspension system requires no lubrication. Maintenance is limited to periodic inspections to insure specified torque values are maintained (refer to the TORQUE CHART) and leveling bolts and pads are in place and tight. If leveling bolts and axle pad-adjustment seat are loose or missing, refer to U-BOLTS, LEVELING BOLT OR AXLE PAD ADJUSTMENT SEAT, for proper procedure.

svcproc.title: U-BOLT
svcproc.para: It is important that the U-bolt nuts be retightened at the intervals listed below. This applies to both new vehicles and to vehicles on which U-bolts have been replaced for any reason.

step1.para: The U-bolts must be retightened after the vehicle has operated under load for 1,000 miles (1600 km) or three (3) months, whichever occurs first.
Thereafter, the U-bolt nuts should be checked for proper torque every 5,000 miles (8045 km) or at regular preventive maintenance intervals.
